course_title: Special Topics: Human Health: Vaccines + Immunology in HLTH
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 30 / Seats Avail: 2Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: This course will discuss vaccine discovery, dissemination, and impact of vaccines across the globe, and their impact on human health from a historical and present-day perspective. Special consideration will be given to the mechanisms that different vaccines employ to confer efficacy, along with their safety across populations. The impact of existing vaccines have on humanity, as well as the knowledge that past vaccine strategies provide towards preparedness for future global diseases will also be discussed.
course_description: Seminar of lecture series of topics in human health. May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Credit varies from one to four hours.
sections: Class Nbr: 2961, Section #: 5, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 11:30a-12:45p, Instructor: Gavegnano/Reece, Status: Open
